Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp.auth

Class AuthPipeline

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp.auth.AuthPipeline
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SMTPPipeline
    public class AuthPipeline
extends java.lang.Object
implements SMTPPipeline
    Authentication pipeline for SPF, DKIM, and DMARC checks.

    AuthPipeline implements SMTPPipeline to integrate with SMTPConnection. Configure it with callbacks for the checks you want, then associate it with the connection.

    The pipeline is purely event-driven:

    • SPF check runs at MAIL FROM, delivers result via SPFCallback
    • DKIM verification runs at end-of-data, delivers result via DKIMCallback
    • DMARC evaluation runs when DKIM completes (using accumulated SPF result and From domain), delivers result via DMARCCallback

    Example usage: 

    
 AuthPipeline pipeline = new AuthPipeline.Builder(resolver, clientIP, heloHost)
     .onSPF((result, explanation) -> {
         if (result == SPFResult.FAIL) {
             // Log or take action
         }
     })
     .onDMARC((result, policy, domain, verdict) -> {
         if (verdict == AuthVerdict.REJECT) {
             // Reject message
         }
     })
     .build();
    Author:
    Chris Burdess
    See Also:
    SMTPPipeline, DMARCValidator, DMARCMessageHandler

    • Method Detail

      • mailFrom

        public void mailFrom​(EmailAddress sender)
        Description copied from interface: SMTPPipeline
        Called when MAIL FROM is received.

        This is typically the first notification for a new message. Pipelines can use this to perform sender-based checks (e.g., SPF).

        Specified by:
        mailFrom in interface SMTPPipeline
        Parameters:
        sender - the envelope sender address, or null for bounce messages

      • rcptTo

        public void rcptTo​(EmailAddress recipient)
        Description copied from interface: SMTPPipeline
        Called when RCPT TO is received.

        This may be called multiple times for messages with multiple recipients. Pipelines can use this for recipient-based checks.

        Specified by:
        rcptTo in interface SMTPPipeline
        Parameters:
        recipient - the envelope recipient address

      • getMessageChannel

        public java.nio.channels.WritableByteChannel getMessageChannel()
        Description copied from interface: SMTPPipeline
        Returns a channel to receive raw message bytes.

        Called when DATA transfer begins. If this returns non-null, SMTPConnection will write raw message bytes to the channel as they arrive, and close the channel at end of transfer.

        Returning null indicates the pipeline doesn't need message bytes.

        Specified by:
        getMessageChannel in interface SMTPPipeline
        Returns:
        a writable byte channel, or null

      • endData

        public void endData()
        Description copied from interface: SMTPPipeline
        Called when DATA transfer is complete.

        This is called after the message channel is closed. Pipelines should perform any final processing here (e.g., DKIM verification, DMARC evaluation) and invoke completion callbacks.

        Specified by:
        endData in interface SMTPPipeline

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Description copied from interface: SMTPPipeline
        Called when the transaction is reset.

        This occurs on RSET command, after successful message delivery, or when the connection is closed. Pipelines should clean up any per-message state.

        Specified by:
        reset in interface SMTPPipeline
